title: John Chapter 6 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on John chapter 6 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: John Chapter 6 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of John Chapter 6.

questions.question: Where did Jesus go after these things according to John 6:1?
options: Sea of Galilee
Dead Sea
Mediterranean Sea
Red Sea
questions.correctAnswer: Sea of Galilee
questions.explanation: John 6:1 states that Jesus went over the sea of Galilee, which is also called the sea of Tiberias.

questions.question: Why did a great multitude follow Jesus according to John 6:2?
options: Because they saw his miracles on the diseased
Because he preached loudly
Because he gave them food
Because he was a king
questions.correctAnswer: Because they saw his miracles on the diseased
questions.explanation: John 6:2 explains that a great multitude followed Jesus because they saw the miracles he did on those who were diseased.

questions.question: According to John 6:4, which feast was near?
options: Passover
Pentecost
Tabernacles
Hanukkah
questions.correctAnswer: Passover
questions.explanation: John 6:4 states that the Passover, a feast of the Jews, was near.

questions.question: Who did Jesus ask about buying bread in John 6:5?
options: Philip
Peter
Andrew
John
questions.correctAnswer: Philip
questions.explanation: In John 6:5, Jesus said to Philip, 'Whence shall we buy bread, that these may eat?'

questions.question: How many barley loaves did the lad have according to John 6:9?
options: Five
Two
Seven
Ten
questions.correctAnswer: Five
questions.explanation: John 6:9 says the lad had five barley loaves and two small fishes.

questions.question: About how many men sat down to eat as described in John 6:10?
options: Five thousand
Two thousand
Ten thousand
One thousand
questions.correctAnswer: Five thousand
questions.explanation: John 6:10 states that about five thousand men sat down to eat.

questions.question: What did Jesus do before distributing the loaves and fishes according to John 6:11?
options: Gave thanks
Prayed silently
Sang a hymn
Spoke to the crowd
questions.correctAnswer: Gave thanks
questions.explanation: John 6:11 describes Jesus taking the loaves, giving thanks, and then distributing them to the disciples.

questions.question: How many baskets of fragments were gathered after everyone ate in John 6:13?
options: Twelve
Seven
Five
Ten
questions.correctAnswer: Twelve
questions.explanation: John 6:13 says that they gathered twelve baskets full of fragments left over.

questions.question: What did the people say when they saw the miracle in John 6:14?
options: This is the prophet that should come into the world
He is a great teacher
He is the king of Israel
He is a mighty healer
questions.correctAnswer: This is the prophet that should come into the world
questions.explanation: John 6:14 records that the men said, 'This is of a truth that prophet that should come into the world.'

questions.question: What did Jesus do when He perceived the people wanted to make Him king by force in John 6:15?
options: He departed into a mountain alone
He accepted their offer
He performed another miracle
He taught them about the kingdom
questions.correctAnswer: He departed into a mountain alone
questions.explanation: John 6:15 states that Jesus departed again into a mountain by himself when he saw they wanted to make him king by force.

questions.question: True or False: According to John 6:20, Jesus told his disciples to be afraid when He walked on the sea.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: John 6:20 records Jesus saying, 'It is I; be not afraid,' showing he told them not to be afraid.

questions.question: True or False: According to John 6:26, the people sought Jesus because they saw the miracles He did.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: John 6:26 says Jesus told the people they sought Him not because of the miracles but because they ate the loaves and were filled.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus said in John 6:35 that He is the bread of life.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: John 6:35 quotes Jesus saying, 'I am the bread of life.'

questions.question: Complete this verse from John 6:29: 'This is the work of God, that ye ______ on him whom he hath sent.'
options: believe
pray
follow
worship
questions.correctAnswer: believe
questions.explanation: John 6:29 states, 'This is the work of God, that ye believe on him whom he hath sent.'

questions.question: Who is described as having been chosen among the twelve but also as a devil in John 6:70?
options: Judas Iscariot
Peter
John
Philip
questions.correctAnswer: Judas Iscariot
questions.explanation: John 6:70 identifies Judas Iscariot as the one chosen among the twelve who is called a devil.

medium.title: John Chapter 6 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from John Chapter 6 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A believer is worried about not having enough resources to help others. Based on John 6, what biblical truth encourages generosity and trust in God's provision?
options: God can multiply even small offerings to meet great needs
We should only give when we have abundance
Helping others is optional and depends on our resources
Miracles happen only for the wealthy
questions.correctAnswer: God can multiply even small offerings to meet great needs
questions.explanation: John 6:8-13 shows how Jesus used five barley loaves and two fishes to feed five thousand, teaching us that God can multiply our small gifts to bless many.

questions.question: How does John 6 teach about faith when facing doubt or confusion about Jesus' teachings?
options: Belief in Jesus is the work God requires
We should only believe what we can fully understand
Faith is optional for discipleship
Doubt means we should leave Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: Belief in Jesus is the work God requires
questions.explanation: In John 6:28-29, Jesus tells the crowd that the work God requires is to believe in the one He sent, emphasizing faith as central to Christian life.

questions.question: What practical lesson about perseverance can be drawn from the disciples' response when Jesus walked on the sea during the storm?
options: Trusting Jesus brings peace even in fearful trials
We must face storms alone without help
Fear shows lack of faith and leads to failure
Jesus only helps when the sea is calm
questions.correctAnswer: Trusting Jesus brings peace even in fearful trials
questions.explanation: John 6:19-21 shows the disciples afraid during the storm, but Jesus reassures them, teaching that faith in Him brings peace amid life's storms.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with spiritual hunger and dissatisfaction. How does John 6 guide us in finding true satisfaction?
options: Jesus is the bread of life who satisfies spiritual hunger
Earthly food will satisfy our deepest needs
Seeking miracles is the key to fulfillment
Only strict fasting leads to satisfaction
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus is the bread of life who satisfies spiritual hunger
questions.explanation: John 6:35 explains Jesus as the bread of life, promising that those who come to Him will never hunger or thirst spiritually.

questions.question: What does John 6 teach about humility and contentment in the example of the boy with five barley loaves and two fishes?
options: Even small, humble offerings are valuable when given to Jesus
Only large gifts are useful in God's kingdom
We should be ashamed of what little we have
God prefers gifts from the wealthy
questions.correctAnswer: Even small, humble offerings are valuable when given to Jesus
questions.explanation: In John 6:9, the boy’s small provision seemed insignificant, but Jesus used it to feed thousands, showing that humble gifts are precious in God's hands.

questions.question: How does Jesus’ statement in John 6:37 teach about God's promise and assurance for believers facing rejection or doubt?
options: All who come to Jesus will never be rejected
Only perfect people are accepted by Jesus
Believers must earn acceptance by good works
Some who seek Jesus may be turned away
questions.correctAnswer: All who come to Jesus will never be rejected
questions.explanation: John 6:37 promises that everyone the Father gives to Jesus will come to Him and He will never cast them out, assuring believers of God's acceptance.

questions.question: How does John 6 encourage believers to focus their labor and efforts in daily life?
options: Labor for the eternal life God gives, not just for temporary needs
Work only for material wealth
Avoid labor and depend on others
Labor is unimportant for spiritual life
questions.correctAnswer: Labor for the eternal life God gives, not just for temporary needs
questions.explanation: John 6:27 teaches believers to labor not for perishable food but for the food that endures to eternal life, emphasizing spiritual priorities in work.

questions.question: According to John 6, what attitude should a Christian have when hearing difficult teachings from Jesus that challenge their understanding?
options: We should respond with faith and seek deeper understanding
Reject teachings that are hard to accept
Ignore spiritual challenges and avoid questions
Only follow teachings that are easy to understand
questions.correctAnswer: We should respond with faith and seek deeper understanding
questions.explanation: John 6:60-61 shows some disciples struggling with Jesus’ words, but He invites them to reflect and continue in faith rather than turning away.

questions.question: What practical lesson about evangelism and sharing the Gospel can be taken from the crowd’s reaction after Jesus fed the five thousand?
options: People are drawn to Jesus by His miracles and provision
Evangelism should rely only on words, not actions
Miracles are unnecessary for faith
Crowds should be avoided in ministry
questions.correctAnswer: People are drawn to Jesus by His miracles and provision
questions.explanation: John 6:14-15 shows that the crowd recognized Jesus as a prophet after the miracle, indicating how God's works can open hearts to the Gospel.

questions.question: How does John 6 teach about the importance of spiritual nourishment over physical nourishment?
options: Jesus is the true bread from heaven offering eternal life
Physical food is the only true sustenance
Spiritual matters are less important than physical needs
Only rituals provide spiritual nourishment
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus is the true bread from heaven offering eternal life
questions.explanation: John 6:32-33 contrasts manna with Jesus, the true bread from heaven that gives life to the world, emphasizing spiritual nourishment.

questions.question: A believer feels tempted to turn away from Jesus when His teachings seem difficult. What encouragement does John 6 offer about perseverance and faith?
options: Those given by the Father will be drawn to Jesus and raised up
It is normal to give up if teachings are hard
Only the strongest survive faith
Faith is optional and can be discarded
questions.correctAnswer: Those given by the Father will be drawn to Jesus and raised up
questions.explanation: John 6:44 and 6:39 reassure believers that God draws them to Jesus and will raise them up, encouraging perseverance despite difficulties.

questions.question: True or False: According to John 6, Jesus emphasizes that His flesh and blood are symbolic and not essential for eternal life.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: John 6:53-56 clearly states that eating Jesus’ flesh and drinking His blood is necessary for life, showing the importance of intimate union with Him.

questions.question: True or False: John 6 teaches that belief in Jesus is the only work God requires from us for eternal life.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: John 6:29 teaches that to believe in Jesus, whom God has sent, is the work God requires, highlighting faith as essential for salvation.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jesus said, "I am the bread of life: he that cometh to me shall never _____; and he that believeth on me shall never _____."
options: hunger, thirst
faint, fall
fear, doubt
sleep, hunger
questions.correctAnswer: hunger, thirst
questions.explanation: John 6:35 records Jesus saying that those who come to Him will never hunger or thirst, symbolizing spiritual satisfaction and eternal life.

questions.question: How does John 6 illustrate the importance of gratitude and thankfulness in daily life?
options: Jesus gave thanks before distributing the loaves and fishes
Gratitude is optional for believers
Only priests should give thanks
Thankfulness is not mentioned in this chapter
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus gave thanks before distributing the loaves and fishes
questions.explanation: John 6:11 shows Jesus giving thanks before breaking the bread, teaching the practice of gratitude before receiving God's provision.

hard.title: John Chapter 6 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from John Chapter 6.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus referring to Himself as 'the bread of life' in John 6, especially in relation to the manna eaten by the Israelites in the wilderness?
options: Jesus offers eternal life, unlike the manna which only temporarily sustained life
Jesus was comparing His flesh to manna's physical taste
Jesus was emphasizing the quantity of bread He provided
Jesus was discounting the importance of physical bread
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus offers eternal life, unlike the manna which only temporarily sustained life
questions.explanation: In John 6:48-50, Jesus contrasts Himself with the manna eaten by the Israelites, pointing out that while their fathers ate manna and died, He is the living bread that gives eternal life.

questions.question: How does the miracle of feeding the five thousand in John 6 foreshadow the Christian Eucharist?
options: Jesus distributes bread and fish, symbolizing His body and blood given for the world
It was simply a demonstration of Jesus' power over nature
It was a moment of political empowerment for Jesus as king
It was a fulfillment of Old Testament prophecy about a great feast
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus distributes bread and fish, symbolizing His body and blood given for the world
questions.explanation: John 6:11-13 shows Jesus giving thanks and distributing bread and fish, which prefigures His later teaching about eating His flesh and drinking His blood (John 6:53-56), foundational to the Eucharist.

questions.question: In John 6, what is the cultural and religious significance of the Passover being near (John 6:4) to the overall narrative?
options: It sets the stage for Jesus as the sacrificial Lamb and Messiah
It indicates a time for pilgrimages to the temple
It explains why the crowds were so large
It signifies the start of the Jewish new year
questions.correctAnswer: It sets the stage for Jesus as the sacrificial Lamb and Messiah
questions.explanation: The Passover context (John 6:4) foreshadows Jesus’ role as the Lamb of God, whose flesh and blood bring life, paralleling the Passover lamb’s sacrifice in Exodus.

questions.question: How does the Greek word for 'life' (ζωή, zoe) used in John 6 deepen the meaning of Jesus' promise to give 'life unto the world'?
options: It denotes eternal, divine life beyond mere physical existence
It refers only to physical survival
It is a generic term without special theological meaning
It suggests temporary blessings on earth
questions.correctAnswer: It denotes eternal, divine life beyond mere physical existence
questions.explanation: John 6:33 uses the word ζωή (zoe) to signify eternal, spiritual life that Jesus imparts, distinguishing it from physical life.

questions.question: What literary device is strongly present in John 6:35 when Jesus says, 'I am the bread of life'?
options: Metaphor
Simile
Hyperbole
Allegory
questions.correctAnswer: Metaphor
questions.explanation: Jesus uses metaphor (John 6:35) to identify Himself as essential for spiritual sustenance, paralleling physical bread’s necessity for physical life.

questions.question: According to John 6, what is the Father’s role in drawing people to Jesus?
options: The Father draws people to Jesus, enabling them to come
People come to Jesus entirely by their own will
The Father only judges, not draws
Jesus draws people independently of the Father
questions.correctAnswer: The Father draws people to Jesus, enabling them to come
questions.explanation: John 6:44 explains that no one can come to Jesus unless the Father draws them, highlighting divine initiative in salvation.

questions.question: Which Old Testament event is alluded to in John 6:31-32 when Jesus talks about bread from heaven?
options: The giving of manna in the wilderness to the Israelites
The multiplication of Elijah’s bread by the ravens
The feeding of Elijah by the angel
The Passover meal in Egypt
questions.correctAnswer: The giving of manna in the wilderness to the Israelites
questions.explanation: Jesus references the manna given to Israel during the Exodus journey (John 6:31-32), contrasting it with the true bread from heaven He provides.

questions.question: True or False: In John 6, Jesus explicitly states that His flesh and blood must be eaten and drunk in a literal sense to have life.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: John 6:53-56 records Jesus saying 'Except ye eat the flesh of the Son of man, and drink his blood, ye have no life in you,' emphasizing the necessity of partaking in Him for eternal life.

questions.question: How does Jesus’ walking on the sea in John 6:19-21 connect to Old Testament themes?
options: It echoes God’s sovereignty over the chaotic waters in Genesis and Psalms
It is a unique New Testament event with no Old Testament parallels
It represents a political claim to kingship over Israel
It is a metaphor for overcoming sin
questions.correctAnswer: It echoes God’s sovereignty over the chaotic waters in Genesis and Psalms
questions.explanation: Jesus walking on the sea (John 6:19-21) recalls God's mastery over the chaotic waters (e.g., Genesis 1:2-10, Psalm 77:19), affirming His divine authority.

questions.question: What is the significance of the twelve baskets of leftovers collected after the feeding of the five thousand (John 6:13)?
options: They symbolize the twelve tribes of Israel, indicating provision for all God's people
They are a sign of wastefulness
They represent the twelve apostles becoming kings
They are a literal accounting of food
questions.correctAnswer: They symbolize the twelve tribes of Israel, indicating provision for all God's people
questions.explanation: The twelve baskets (John 6:13) allude to the twelve tribes of Israel, symbolizing that Jesus’ provision and salvation extend to all God's covenant people.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: In John 6:29, Jesus says the work of God is that you ____.
options: believe on him whom he hath sent
perform many miracles
keep all the commandments
offer sacrifices
questions.correctAnswer: believe on him whom he hath sent
questions.explanation: John 6:29 explicitly states that the work God requires is believing in Jesus, the one sent by the Father.

questions.question: Why did many disciples leave Jesus after His teaching on eating His flesh and drinking His blood, according to John 6:60-66?
options: They found the teaching too difficult or offensive to accept
They wanted Jesus to perform more miracles
They disagreed with His political ambitions
They were persuaded by the Pharisees
questions.correctAnswer: They found the teaching too difficult or offensive to accept
questions.explanation: John 6:60 and 66 show that many disciples said 'This is an hard saying' and 'went back, and walked no more with him,' indicating offense at the teaching.

questions.question: What is the theological significance of Jesus saying 'It is the spirit that quickeneth; the flesh profiteth nothing' in John 6:63?
options: Spiritual reality brings life, not mere physical actions or fleshly understanding
Physical bread is more important than spiritual bread
Jesus denies the importance of His physical body
The flesh is sinful and must be rejected
questions.correctAnswer: Spiritual reality brings life, not mere physical actions or fleshly understanding
questions.explanation: John 6:63 emphasizes that spiritual truth imparts life, while flesh alone has no benefit, highlighting the importance of faith and spiritual perception.

questions.question: In John 6:70-71, Jesus refers to one of the twelve as a devil. Who is this individual and what is his role?
options: Judas Iscariot, who would betray Jesus
Peter, who would deny Jesus
John, who would write a gospel
Thomas, who would doubt Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: Judas Iscariot, who would betray Jesus
questions.explanation: John 6:71 identifies Judas Iscariot as the chosen disciple who would betray Jesus, symbolizing the presence of evil even among the twelve.

questions.question: True or False: In John 6:27, Jesus instructs people to labor for food that perishes rather than for food that endures to eternal life.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: John 6:27 instructs people not to labor for perishable food but for the food that endures to eternal life, which the Son of man gives.

theological.title: John Chapter 6 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from John Chapter 6 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What title does the crowd use to address Jesus when they find Him on the other side of the sea?
options: Rabbi
Prophet
King
Son of God
questions.correctAnswer: Rabbi
questions.explanation: In John 6:25, the crowd calls Jesus 'Rabbi' when they find Him, recognizing Him as a teacher, which aligns with Old Testament respect for God’s appointed teachers (Exodus 24:12, Psalm 25:4-5).

questions.question: What does Jesus say is the true work of God?
options: Believing on Him whom God has sent
Performing miracles
Feeding the hungry
Observing the Sabbath
questions.correctAnswer: Believing on Him whom God has sent
questions.explanation: John 6:29 teaches that the work of God is to believe in Jesus, consistent with the emphasis on faith for salvation in Hebrews 11:6 and John 3:16.

questions.question: How does Jesus describe the bread He gives compared to the manna the Israelites ate in the wilderness?
options: It gives eternal life, unlike manna which could not prevent death
It is a physical bread like manna
It is only for the Jewish people
It is less significant than manna
questions.correctAnswer: It gives eternal life, unlike manna which could not prevent death
questions.explanation: Jesus contrasts the manna which sustained physical life temporarily (John 6:49) with the living bread that gives eternal life (John 6:50-51), fulfilling the promise of everlasting life in John 3:16 and Psalm 119:103.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus saying, 'I am the bread of life'?
options: He sustains spiritual life and offers eternal satisfaction
He provides physical nourishment
He is a prophet like Moses
He will provide manna again
questions.correctAnswer: He sustains spiritual life and offers eternal satisfaction
questions.explanation: In John 6:35, Jesus declares Himself the bread of life, indicating that faith in Him fulfills the deepest spiritual hunger, resonating with Old Testament themes of God as provider (Psalm 23:1) and Messiah as sustainer (Isaiah 55:1-2).

questions.question: According to Jesus, what must one do to have eternal life?
options: Eat His flesh and drink His blood
Follow the Law strictly
Attend the synagogue regularly
Perform good works
questions.correctAnswer: Eat His flesh and drink His blood
questions.explanation: Jesus teaches in John 6:53-54 that eternal life comes through partaking in Him spiritually, reflecting the new covenant in His blood (Luke 22:20), and the necessity of union with Christ (Romans 6:3-5).

questions.question: Why did many of Jesus' disciples turn back and no longer follow Him?
options: Because His teaching about eating His flesh was difficult to accept
Because He did not perform enough miracles
Because He refused to become a king
Because He asked them to give up their possessions
questions.correctAnswer: Because His teaching about eating His flesh was difficult to accept
questions.explanation: John 6:60 and 66 show that many disciples found Jesus' teaching hard, causing them to leave, illustrating the challenge of true discipleship and belief in Jesus' sacrificial atonement (Matthew 7:14, Luke 9:23).

questions.question: Who is the one Jesus refers to as a devil among the twelve disciples?
options: Judas Iscariot
Simon Peter
Andrew
James
questions.correctAnswer: Judas Iscariot
questions.explanation: In John 6:70-71, Jesus identifies Judas Iscariot as the one who will betray Him, linking to the Old Testament prediction of betrayal (Psalm 41:9) and fulfillment in the New Testament betrayal narrative (Matthew 26:14-16).

questions.question: What does Jesus say about those whom the Father gives Him?
options: They will come to Him and He will never cast them out
They must earn their way through works
They can be lost if they sin
They are only from Israel
questions.correctAnswer: They will come to Him and He will never cast them out
questions.explanation: John 6:37 teaches the doctrine of divine preservation of believers, consistent with the security of the believer in John 10:28-29 and Romans 8:38-39.

questions.question: What does Jesus say about His mission in relation to His own will?
options: He came to do the will of the Father who sent Him
He came to establish His own kingdom
He came to abolish the Law
He came to seek honor for Himself
questions.correctAnswer: He came to do the will of the Father who sent Him
questions.explanation: John 6:38 emphasizes Jesus' obedience to the Father’s will, reflecting the Servant motif in Isaiah 53 and the unity of purpose within the Trinity (Philippians 2:5-8).

questions.question: What does Jesus say will happen to those who eat His flesh and drink His blood?
options: They have eternal life and will be raised up on the last day
They will become prophets
They will never experience suffering
They will be given wealth
questions.correctAnswer: They have eternal life and will be raised up on the last day
questions.explanation: John 6:54 promises eternal life and resurrection for believers, consistent with resurrection teachings in 1 Corinthians 15:20-22 and Daniel 12:2.

questions.question: How do the people react after seeing the miracle of the feeding of the five thousand?
options: They say Jesus is the prophet who should come into the world
They immediately worship Him as King
They reject Him for not feeding them again
They report Him to the Pharisees
questions.correctAnswer: They say Jesus is the prophet who should come into the world
questions.explanation: John 6:14 records the crowd recognizing Jesus as the prophet like Moses (Deuteronomy 18:15-18), affirming messianic expectations fulfilled in Christ (Acts 3:22-23).

questions.question: What does Jesus say about the spirit and the flesh in relation to His words?
options: The spirit gives life; the flesh profits nothing; His words are spirit and life
The flesh is more important than the spirit
His words are only literal commands
The spirit is irrelevant to understanding His words
questions.correctAnswer: The spirit gives life; the flesh profits nothing; His words are spirit and life
questions.explanation: John 6:63 teaches that spiritual understanding is vital for life, consistent with the teaching in Ezekiel 37:14 about the Spirit giving life and Jesus’ promise of the Spirit in John 14:26.

questions.question: What reason does Jesus give for the Jews murmuring at Him when He says, 'I am the bread which came down from heaven'?
options: They know His earthly parents and question His divine origin
They dislike His teachings on the Law
They want Him to perform more miracles
They think He is a political rebel
questions.correctAnswer: They know His earthly parents and question His divine origin
questions.explanation: John 6:41-42 shows the Jews struggling to reconcile Jesus' claim of heavenly origin with His human lineage, reflecting common skepticism about the incarnation (Isaiah 7:14, Micah 5:2).

questions.question: What does Jesus say about the necessity of the Father's drawing for one to come to Him?
options: No one can come to Jesus unless the Father draws them
Anyone can come to Jesus without any divine influence
Only the Jews are drawn by the Father
One must come through the Law first
questions.correctAnswer: No one can come to Jesus unless the Father draws them
questions.explanation: John 6:44 emphasizes divine initiative in salvation, consistent with teachings on God's sovereign grace in John 15:16 and Romans 8:30.

questions.question: How did Jesus demonstrate His power over nature when the disciples were on the sea?
options: He walked on the sea toward their ship
He calmed the wind immediately
He multiplied food for them
He made the sea dry up
questions.correctAnswer: He walked on the sea toward their ship
questions.explanation: John 6:19 records Jesus walking on water, demonstrating His divine authority over creation, echoing Old Testament theophanies like God’s control over the sea (Psalm 77:19, Job 9:8).
